Unexpected Findings From Sitemap Planning

What planning before building actually saves you

!

Sitemap in 37 seconds vs 3 hours of whiteboard pain

Design agency used to whiteboard sitemaps for 3+ hours per client. Team arguing about pages, structure, navigation flow. Client changes mind halfway through. Everyone frustrated. Relume AI: prompt "marketing agency for B2B SaaS companies" ‚Üí 18-page sitemap in 37 seconds. Team spent 15 minutes tweaking instead of 3 hours debating. Client approved first version. 12x faster planning, zero drama.

!

Export to Framer: seamless handoff, zero rebuild

Founder planned 23-page SaaS site in Relume: sitemap generated in 30 seconds, wireframes in 4 minutes. Exported to Framer ‚Üí every page created automatically, components ready to customize, navigation linked, just add content. Total build time: 2 hours. Same project without planning: 8 hours total, including 3 hours of rebuilds due to structural changes discovered mid-build.

!

Free tier: 3 projects is enough for most freelancers

Freelance designer uses Relume free tier exclusively. 3 projects limit: she plans one project at a time. Workflow: Plan in Relume (free), export to Webflow, build site, get paid, archive Relume project, start next one. Never hits limit because she doesn't need active projects sitting around. Free tier = free forever for her workflow. She's saved $720/year (paid plan is $60/mo).

!

Component library: massive time saver for non-designers

Startup founder isn't a designer. Used to spend hours on navbars, footers, hero sections, pricing tables‚Äîalways looked amateur. Relume's component library: 1,000+ professional components, just swap content. Picked navbar style, swapped logo and links. Chose hero section, updated headline and CTA. Site looks like $10K agency build. Actual cost: $0 (free tier). Clients ask "which agency did you hire?"

!

Style guide generator: brand consistency automated

Relume generated complete style guide in seconds: colors (primary, secondary, accent), typography (headings, body, buttons), spacing system, button styles, form inputs, cards. Export to Framer ‚Üí all styles applied automatically across every page. No inconsistent branding. No client asking "why does this page look different?" Every page cohesive from day one. Zero manual styling required.

!

Client approvals: 2x faster with visual planning

Agency tracked 50 client projects. Projects with Relume planning: average 2 revision rounds before approval. Projects without planning: 4 revision rounds. Why? Clients can SEE the structure before building. No "I didn't know there would be a blog" or "where's the testimonial section?" Visual sitemap = clear expectations = fewer revisions = faster payment.

My Experience

The 4-Minute Wireframe That Saved a $12,000 Project

October 2024. Client‚ÄîAlex‚Äîfintech startup founder. Needed a 27-page website. Budget: $12,000. Timeline: 3 weeks.

Old workflow: Start building in Framer. Discover structural issues halfway through. Rebuild. Repeat. This usually took 4+ weeks on projects this size.

This time, I opened Relume first.

The prompt: "Fintech startup for Gen Z investors. Needs: homepage, product features, pricing, about, blog (5 posts), FAQ, contact, press kit, investor portal, help center, 3 case studies, comparison page vs competitors, careers, legal pages."

37 seconds later: Complete sitemap with 27 pages. Hierarchical structure. Navigation flow planned. Page relationships mapped.

4 minutes later: Every page wireframed. Hero sections, content blocks, CTAs positioned. Navigation structure visualized. Mobile responsiveness planned.

I shared with Alex: "Here's your site structure. Anything you want to change?"

Alex's feedback: "Move careers to footer. Add testimonials to pricing. Split help center into categories."

5 minutes later: Changes applied. Alex approved structure. Exported to Framer. Every page created automatically. Components ready. Just add content.

Total planning time: 15 minutes including client feedback loop.

Build time: 10 days instead of 4 weeks.

Delivered on time. Client paid $12,000 on schedule. No scope creep. No structural rebuilds. No stress.

Without Relume? This project would've taken 4-5 weeks with at least 2 major structural rebuilds. Would've missed deadline. Would've lost the client or had to discount. Planning first saved the project.

What Relume Does Best

üó∫Ô∏è Sitemap Generation

Describe your site, get complete page structure in seconds. Navigation flow, page hierarchy, relationships‚Äîall planned before you build. No more "where does this page go?" debates.

Perfect for: Complex sites, client projects, team collaboration

üìê Wireframe Generation

AI generates page layouts with sections, components, content blocks. See exactly what each page looks like before building. Export as starting point for Framer or Webflow.

Perfect for: Visualizing structure, client approvals, planning content

üé® Component Library

1,000+ professional components: navbars, heroes, features, pricing, testimonials, CTAs, footers. Mix and match. Every component responsive, accessible, conversion-optimized.

Perfect for: Non-designers, rapid prototyping, consistent branding

üöÄ Seamless Export

Export to Framer, Webflow, React, or copy-paste code. Sitemaps become site structure. Wireframes become starting pages. Components become customizable blocks. Zero manual recreation.

Perfect for: Handoff to builders, developers, clients

How Relume Fits Your Workflow

üéØ For Designers: Relume ‚Üí Framer Pipeline

Plan site structure in Relume (5 minutes). Export to Framer. Every page created automatically. Components ready to customize. Add your design flair. Launch in hours, not days. This is the modern designer workflow‚ÄîRelume plans, Framer builds. No more starting from blank canvas.

üíº For Agencies: Client Approval First, Build Later

Show clients sitemap and wireframes BEFORE building. Get structure approved. Eliminate "I didn't know there would be a blog" surprises. Export to Webflow once approved. Build with confidence. Fewer revisions, faster payments, happier clients.

üöÄ For Founders: Plan Your Vision, Hand Off to Developers

You know what you want. Plan it in Relume. Export sitemap and wireframes as specs. Hand to developer‚Äîthey know exactly what to build. No miscommunication. No "that's not what I wanted." Clear specs = right build, first time.

üìù For Content Teams: Structure First, Content Second

See every page before writing. Know what content goes where. Plan content gaps ("we need testimonials for pricing page"). Export structure, writers fill content, designers add visuals. No content written for pages that get cut. No rewriting because structure changed.

‚úÖ Relume is Worth It If...

‚ùå Skip Relume If...

  • ‚Ä¢ You never work with clients

The Brutal Truth About Relume

!

It's a planning tool, not a builder

Relume doesn't build websites. It plans them. You'll need Framer, Webflow, or code to actually build. Don't expect to publish from Relume. Expect to plan, export, then build elsewhere. If you want all-in-one, use Durable or 10Web.

!

Free tier limitation: 3 active projects

Free tier caps at 3 projects. Hit the limit? Archive old projects to make room. Or upgrade to Pro ($20/mo). For most freelancers, 3 projects is plenty if you archive after completion. Agencies will hit the limit fast.

!

Wireframes are functional, not beautiful

Relume wireframes show structure, not design. Gray boxes, placeholder text, basic shapes. They're planning tools, not portfolio pieces. Don't show wireframes to clients as "your final design." Show them as "your site structure."

!

Export is great, but not magic

Export to Framer creates pages and components, but you still need to add content, customize design, make it yours. Export gives you 60% head start, not 100% done site. Plan for 40% work after export.

!

Learning curve for non-designers

If you don't know sitemaps, wireframes, component libraries‚ÄîRelume has a learning curve. Non-designers might find concepts foreign. Budget 30-60 minutes learning basics: what wireframes show, how sitemaps work, component reusability.

Bottom line: Relume is the best planning tool for website designers and agencies. Not a builder, not for everyone. But if you plan complex sites for clients? It'll save you hours and prevent disasters.

Relume FAQ: Planning Before Building

Is Relume free?

Relume has a permanently free tier with 3 active projects. No credit card required, no time limit. You can archive completed projects to free up space and continue using the free tier indefinitely.

Freelancers who work sequentially can use Relume free forever. Pro plan ($20/month) adds unlimited projects for agencies with multiple concurrent clients.

Can Relume build websites or just plan them?

Relume is a planning tool, not a builder. It generates sitemaps, wireframes, and component libraries‚Äîbut you'll need Framer, Webflow, or code to actually build and publish.

Think of Relume as the blueprint phase: plan your structure in Relume (minutes), export to Framer or Webflow, then build (hours). Don't expect to publish directly from Relume.

What platforms does Relume export to?

Relume exports directly to Framer (best integration), Webflow, React, and generic HTML/CSS code. Framer export is seamless: every page created automatically, components ready to customize, navigation linked.

Webflow export works similarly. React export gives you clean component code. Most designers use the Relume ‚Üí Framer pipeline for fastest builds.

How does Relume compare to Framer's AI?

Different tools for different phases. Relume plans structure (sitemap, wireframes, components). Framer AI builds actual pages.

Use them together: Relume for planning (37 seconds for sitemap), then Framer for building (AI generates content and design). Agencies love this combo‚Äîplan first in Relume, get client approval, then build in Framer. Framer alone = build then rebuild when structure changes. Relume + Framer = plan once, build right the first time.

Is Relume worth it for solo freelancers?

Yes, but use the free tier. Freelancers working on one project at a time rarely hit the 3-project limit.

Workflow: plan site in Relume (free), export to Framer/Webflow, build site, get paid, archive Relume project, start next one. Free tier = $0 forever. If you manage 5+ concurrent client projects, upgrade to Pro ($20/month) for unlimited active projects.

Do I need design experience to use Relume?

No, but non-designers have a 30-60 minute learning curve. You'll learn what sitemaps show (page hierarchy, navigation flow), what wireframes communicate (structure, not design), and how component libraries work.

After that, Relume is easier than starting from scratch because AI generates professional-grade plans. Non-designers often prefer Relume over whiteboarding‚ÄîAI suggests structure you might not know to include.

Can clients see and approve Relume plans?

Yes, and this is Relume's killer feature for agencies. Share sitemap link with clients‚Äîthey see the structure, page relationships, navigation flow. They can comment and request changes before you build anything.

Agencies report 50% fewer revision rounds when clients approve structure first. No more "I didn't know there would be a blog" or "where's the testimonial page?" surprises during build phase.

THE RELUME ROI
CALCULATION FOR AGENCIES

Relume costs $20-45/month. Is it worth it? For freelance designers and agencies, the answer is: if you do 3+ projects/year, Relume pays for itself 5-10√ó over. Here's the math.

TIME SAVINGS = MONEY EARNED

SITEMAP GENERATION TIME SAVINGS

Manual process: Create sitemap from scratch: research competitor structures, brainstorm pages, organize hierarchy, revise with client. Average time: 6-12 hours per project. Most freelancers underprice this phase because it feels like "thinking time" not billable work.

Relume process: Describe business ‚Üí AI generates sitemap in 30 seconds. Review output, adjust prompts, regenerate in minutes. Show client, get feedback, iterate in real-time meeting. Total time: 1-2 hours. Time saved: 5-10 hours per project.

Real example: Freelancer spent 8 hours creating sitemap for local business site. Client feedback: "add service area pages" ‚Üí 2 more hours restructuring. Next project: used Relume. Generated sitemap in 45 seconds. Client feedback: "add locations pages" ‚Üí regenerated in 2 minutes. Total: 1.5 hours vs. 10 hours. Saved 8.5 hours = billed for another small project.

Sitemap generation: 10 hours ‚Üí 1 hour. Relume = 9 hours saved per project.

WIREFRAME LIBRARY TIME SAVINGS

Manual process: Build wireframes component by component in Figma. Hero section: 30 minutes. Feature grid: 45 minutes. Testimonials: 30 minutes. Pricing: 30 minutes. CTA: 15 minutes. 10-page site = 40+ hours of wireframing.

Relume process: Wireframe components pre-built. Drag, drop, customize. Hero: 5 minutes. Feature grid: 8 minutes. Testimonials: 5 minutes. Pricing: 7 minutes. CTA: 3 minutes. 10-page site = 8-12 hours total. Time saved: 28-32 hours per project.

Real example: Agency tracked time on 15 projects. Before Relume: average wireframing time = 38 hours per project. After Relume: average wireframing time = 11 hours per project. Time saved: 27 hours per project √ó 15 projects = 405 hours saved. At $150/hour billable rate = $60,750 additional revenue capacity. Relume cost: $540/year (Studio plan). ROI = 11,154%.

Wireframing: 40 hours ‚Üí 12 hours. Relume = 28 hours saved per project.

CLIENT REVISION REDUCTION

The problem: Clients approve nothing until they see visuals. Wireframes feel abstract. Clients say "looks good" then request major changes during design phase. Each revision round = 4-8 hours of work.

Relume solution: Share sitemap with client early. They see structure, navigation flow, page relationships. Can comment directly. Approve architecture before design starts. Structure changes in sitemap = 2 minutes. Structure changes in design = 8 hours.

Real example: Agency tracked revision rounds before/after Relume. Before: average 3.2 revision rounds per project. After: average 1.4 revision rounds per project. Time saved: 1.8 rounds √ó 6 hours/round = 10.8 hours saved per project. √ó 20 projects/year = 216 hours saved = $32,400 additional revenue.

Client revisions: 3 rounds ‚Üí 1.4 rounds. Relume = 50% fewer revisions.

ANNUAL ROI CALCULATION

The math: Freelancer/agency doing 12 projects/year. Relume Studio: $45/month = $540/year. Time savings per project: sitemap (8 hours) + wireframes (28 hours) + revisions (10 hours) = 46 hours saved per project.

Annual impact: 46 hours √ó 12 projects = 552 hours saved/year. At $100/hour billable rate = $55,200 additional revenue capacity. At $150/hour = $82,800 additional revenue. Relume cost: $540. Net ROI: 10,000% - 15,000%.

Break-even calculation: If you save 3 hours on first project, Relume paid for itself for entire year ($45/month √∑ $100/hour = 0.45 hours). Most users report 40-50 hours saved per project. Break-even happens in first week of use. Everything after = pure profit.

$540/year investment ‚Üí $55K additional capacity. ROI = 10,000%.

RELUME PAYS FOR ITSELF IN ONE PROJECT

Time Saved Per Project

Sitemap: 8 hours. Wireframes: 28 hours. Revisions: 10 hours. Total: 46 hours saved.

Annual Capacity

12 projects √ó 46 hours = 552 hours. At $150/hour = $82,800 value.

Investment

Relume Studio: $45/month = $540/year. ROI: 10,000%+.

If you do 3+ projects/year, Relume is pure profit. Under 3 projects = use free tier.

WHEN RELUME DOESN'T MAKE SENSE

Relume isn't for everyone. Some users shouldn't pay $20-45/month. Here's who should skip Relume and use free alternatives instead.

ONE-TIME PROJECT BUILDERS

The situation: You're building one website‚Äîyour own portfolio, friend's business, personal project. No plans to build more sites. Relume subscription = ongoing cost for one-time benefit.

Free alternative: Relume Free tier (up to 3 sitemaps). Generate sitemap, export structure, build in Webflow/Framer manually. Cancel subscription after first project. No ongoing cost.

Real example: Freelancer built personal portfolio site. Used Relume free trial for sitemap. Built manually in Framer. Cancelled Relume. Total cost: $0. Saved $45/month √ó 12 months = $540/year. One-time projects = free tier only.

One project? Use free tier. Ongoing agency work = pay for subscription.

IN-HOUSE DESIGN TEAMS

The situation: Company has in-house design team building company's sites. Already have design systems, component libraries, established workflows. Relume's generic components don't match brand system.

Better approach: Build internal component library in Figma. Document brand patterns. Create reusable sections. Maintain full control, match brand perfectly. Investment upfront, but pays off over many internal projects.

Real example: SaaS company with 2 in-house designers considered Relume. Realized: brand so specific, generic wireframes wouldn't match. Spent 40 hours building internal Figma library. All company sites now use consistent branded components. Relume would've been generic workaround. Internal library = on-brand forever.

In-house teams = build own library. Relume = generic, not brand-specific.

SUPER SPECIALIZED NICHES

The situation: Agency specializes in highly specific industry with unique needs. E-commerce only (needs product grids, checkout flows). Real estate only (needs MLS integration, property listings). Web apps (needs dashboards, data tables).

Why Relume doesn't fit: Relume's components = generic business needs (hero, features, testimonials). Specialized niches need specialized components (product grids, property cards, data tables). Using Relume = adapt generic components or rebuild anyway.

Real example: E-commerce agency tried Relume. Discovered: zero e-commerce wireframes (product listings, filters, checkout, cart, account pages). Built custom e-commerce library in Figma instead. Relume = wrong tool for their specialization. Niche-specific libraries beat generic ones.

Specialized agencies = build specialized library. Relume = generalist tool.

FIGMA FIRST PURISTS

The mindset: Some designers insist on designing everything from scratch in Figma. Relume feels like "cheating" or constraining creativity. They enjoy the blank canvas process and don't want shortcuts.

Valid preference: If you love the design process and don't want to use pre-built components, Relume adds no value. You'll fight the tool instead of leveraging it. Better to design from scratch in Figma and enjoy the work.

Real example: Award-winning designer tried Relume. Hated it: "feels restrictive, everything looks same-y." Went back to designing from scratch in Figma. Takes longer, but work is unique, wins awards, commands premium rates. Relume = wrong fit for their creative process.

Design purists = skip Relume. Build from scratch = creative freedom.

THE BOTTOM LINE: RELUME DECISION

Relume ($20-45/month) is a specialized tool for a specific user: freelance designers and agencies who build 3+ websites/year using Figma and Webflow. For this user, Relume saves 40-50 hours per project = $55K+ annual revenue capacity. ROI exceeds 10,000%. For everyone else‚Äîone-time projects, in-house teams, specialized niches, design purists‚ÄîRelume adds unnecessary cost or constrains creativity.

Use Relume free tier when: Building one website. Testing the platform before committing. Learning sitemap and wireframe principles. Generate sitemap, export, cancel subscription. No ongoing cost for one-time use.

Pay for Relume Studio ($45/mo) when: You're a freelancer or agency building 3+ sites/year. You use Figma + Webflow workflow. You want to save 40-50 hours per project. You need client approval on structure before design. You're the 20% who can scale the savings into revenue.

Agency proved Relume's value: saved 46 hours per project √ó 12 projects/year = 552 hours = $82,800 additional revenue. Relume cost: $540/year. ROI: 15,244%. Freelancer proved free tier value: built portfolio site with free trial, cancelled, saved $540/year. E-commerce agency proved specialization reality: Relume lacked e-commerce components, built custom library instead. Relume = generalist tool for generalist needs. If you're generalist agency building 3+ sites/year in Figma/Webflow, Relume pays for itself in first project. Everything after = pure profit. If you're specialist, purist, or one-timer, skip Relume. The free tier exists for exactly these users.

TRUE DESIGN QUALITY

Components follow modern design principles. Spacing, typography, hierarchy all dialed in. Your sites look professional by default.
